alert.note: Alert for Burnett; Douglas; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 5:29PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN PINE, SOUTHWESTERN DOUGLAS, NORTHERN WASHBURN AND NORTHEASTERN BURNETT COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM CDT... At 529 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Cloverton, to near Duxbury, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cloverton around 540 PM CDT. Dairyland around 545 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wascott, Minong and Webb Lake Wisconsin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. These storms may intensify. Monitor local NOAA Weather Radio, commercial radio, or television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Minnesota...and northwestern Wisconsin.
